en: So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David; and Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abija chu a thlatuhai kuoma chun a in tah a, ama chu David khawpuia chun an phûm a, a naupa Asa chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a; ama inlal sûng chun kum sâwm sûng chu ram chu râlmuongin a um a.

en: And Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of Jehovah his God:
hmr: Chun, Asa chun a Pathien, LALPA mithmuah thil indik le ṭhahai chu a thawh a;

en: for he took away the foreign altars, and the high places, and brake down the pillars, and hewed down the Asherim,
hmr: bâwlhmunhai le mâichâm dang- lamhai chu a lâk hmang a, lungphun- hai chu a sukthliek a, Asera chu a phûr thlûk bawk a;

en: and commanded Judah to seek Jehovah, the God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.
hmr: chun, Juda mihai chu an thla- tuhai Pathien LALPA chu zawnga thupêk le dânhai chu thaw pei dingin thu a pêk bawk a.

en: Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the sun-images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.
hmr: Juda ram sûng khawpui po pohaia inthawk chun bâwlhmunhai le nisa limhai chu a lâk hmang vawng a; ram chu ama hmaa chun a re ṭawk ṭawk a.

en: And he built fortified cities in Judah; for the land was quiet, and he had no war in those years, because Jehovah had given him rest.
hmr: Juda rama chun khawpui kul neihai chu a bâwl a, LALPAIN ama chu châwlna a pêk leiin, ram chu a re ṭawk ṭawk a, chuong kumahai chun indona a nei si nawh a.

en: For he said unto Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about them walls, and towers, gates, and bars; the land is yet before us, because we have sought Jehovah our God; we have sought him, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, Juda mihai kuoma chun, “Hieng khawpuihai hi bâwl ei tiu a, a banghai, a kulbîng insânghai, a dai kawtkhârhai le a kalna thîrhai siem ei tiu; ei Pathien LALPA chu ei zawng leiin ram chu ei hnuoiah a um a nih; ama chu ei zawng leiin kil tinah ama chun châwl a mi pêk a ni hi,” a ta. Chuongchun, an bâwl a, hlaw khawm an hlawtling pei tah a.

en: And Asa had an army that bare bucklers and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bare shields and drew bows, two hundred and fourscore thousand: all these were mighty men of valor.
hmr: Chun, Asa chun Juda hnama inthawkin âwmphâw le fei chawi mi sipai nuoi thum a nei a; Benjamin hnama inthawkin phaw chawia thal- ngul kuoi mi nuoi hni le sîng riet a nei bawk a: hieng mihai po po hi mi hrât khawkhêng ruok an nih.

en: And there came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with an army of a thousand thousand, and three hundred chariots; and he came unto Mareshah.
hmr: Chun, Ethiopia mi Zera chun sipai maktaduoi khat le sakawr tawlailîr za thum leh anni chu a hung thawh a; ama chu Maresa chenin a hung a.

en: Then Asa went out to meet him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.
hmr: Chun, Asa chu ama tuok ding chun a suok a, Maresaa Zephatha ruoma chun indo ding chun an inep tah a.

en: And Asa cried unto Jehovah his God, and said, Jehovah, there is none besides thee to help, between the mighty and him that hath no strength: help us, O Jehovah our God; for we rely on thee, and in thy name are we come against this multitude. O Jehovah, thou art our God; let not man prevail against thee.
hmr: Asa chu a Pathien LALPA kuoma chun a khêk a, “LALPA chau naw chu, hrâtna nei lo mihai ta dinga, mi thilthawtheia inthawka ṭhangpui ding mi dang tukhawm an um nawh a; Aw LALPA kan Pathien, mi ṭhang- pui la; nangmaah kan innghat sih a, hi mipui hi i hming leiin kan hung do a ni hi. Aw LALPA nang chu kan Pathien i na, nangma chu tukhawma hne naw raw se che,” tiin.

en: So Jehovah smote the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun Asa hmaa le Juda mihai hmaa chun Ethiopia mihai chu a hung thawh a; Ethiopia mihai chu an tlânse tah a.

en: And Asa and the people that were with him pursued them unto Gerar: and there fell of the Ethiopians so many that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before Jehovah, and before his host; and they carried away very much booty.
hmr: Asa le a kuoma mipui umhai chun anni chu Gerar chenin an hnawt a; Ethiopia mihai chu nasatakin an thi a, ṭhang an khaw thei ta nawh a; LALPA le a sipaihai hmaa chun sukbohmangin an um a; anni chun râllâk sum tamtak an lâk a.

en: And they smote all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of Jehovah came upon them: and they despoiled all the cities; for there was much spoil in them.
hmr: Chun, Gerar vêla khuohai po po chu a thaw vawng a, LALPA ṭitna chu an chunga chun a hung tlung tâwl sih a, khawpuihai po po chu an suksiet a, chuonga hai chun râllâk thil tam- takhai chu a um sih a.

en: They smote also the tents of cattle, and carried away sheep in abundance, and camels, and returned to Jerusalem.
hmr: Ran ruol bûkhai chu an rûn pei a, berâm tamtakhai le sanghâwngsei leh an lâk ṭeu a, Jerusalemah an kîr tah a.
